noun.description: A sovereign ruler of great power and rank, especially one ruling an empire.
An orange and brown North American butterfly with a swift dodging flight, breeding chiefly on hackberries.

phrases: is his white canvas a case of the emperor's new clothes or is it something beautiful, even moving?
this is the first time that anyone has stripped his work of its rhetoric and shown that this particular emperor has no clothes
I tend to think that if the emperor has no clothes, it doesn't matter how smart one claims to be or how deep one's point may be.
It is doubtful that anyone will tell the senator that the emperor has no clothes.
Like the mythical emperor's new clothes, the obscurity of highbrow discourse was merely a mystique that charlatans used to confound the gullible.
origin: Middle English (especially representing the title given to the head of the Roman Empire): from Old French emperere, from Latin imperator military commander, from imperare to command, from in- towards + parare prepare, contrive.
